page.title: 11ELMLEY CASTLE, WAY OF LIFE
page.content: Since the Second World War the population has changed from a community of old families to one of commuters and retired people.People who choose to live in this popular area are prepared to travel for shops, services and employment.Most families have a car.The shops and post offices in Elmley Castle and Little Comberton closed last year. A mobile grocer, greengrocer and library call weekly. Newspapers can be collected from outside village halls.The Parish Magazine is delivered free monthly to all homes.Social life centres around the village halls,public houses ,the Church and private homes.
